intro: Gilia gracilis var. micrantha, commonly known as the slender gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, slender stems and small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in late spring to early summer. The species is often found in association with other wildflowers, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
